title: 105_s1277
content: The text introduces a new part in the Internal Revenue Code regarding the designation of overpayments and contributions for the benefit of units of the National Park System. It includes Section 6097 which outlines the designation process. Individual taxpayers can designate a specified portion of any overpayment of tax and cash contributions on their tax return to benefit units of the National Park System. This designation must be made at the time of filing the tax return and will be treated as a refund to the taxpayer. The taxpayer can designate a portion of overpaid tax as a refund to benefit National Park System units. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1997. The National Parks Trust Fund is established under the Internal Revenue Code to benefit National Park System units. The National Parks Trust Fund is created in the Treasury of the United States to receive appropriations and credits. Amounts designated under section 6097 are appropriated to the Trust Fund. The Secretary pays the National Park Service from the Trust Fund for park facility projects. The National Parks Trust Fund is used for repairing high priority facilities in National Parks to enhance visitor experience, protect natural, cultural, and historical resources. Administrative expenses are covered for tax return modifications and processing funds. A study on the program's effects must be submitted to Congress within 2 years.
